title: Hydatid cyst of the calf presenting as painless mass: A case report
patient:
We present a 60-year-old lady presented to the surgical consultation room complaining from painless mass in the right calf for the last 2 years.
The mass accidentally discovered 2 years before presentation which was diagnosed that time clinically as lipoma, the patient didn’t receive any treatment at that time.
In the last few months the mass increased gradually in size and the patient was aware about this change in the size.
The patient has hypertension for 10 years controlled with antihypertensive drugs, the past surgical history of the patient included history of laparoscopic cholecystectomy before 10 years and hysterectomy for large uterine fibroid before 5 years. The patient didn’t receive anthelminthic medication before surgery.
